pageTitle: LipscombSports.com - Women's basketball defeats Mercer for first win of season
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {7726=In a historically good night at the free-throw line, Phillips and McAlister combined to hit 19 of their 23 free throws. In all, the Lady Bisons hit 34 of 43 free throws against Mercer, breaking the school women’s basketball record of 31 made free throws against Belmont, Jan. 12 2009., 6163=Thursday, December 01, 2011, 8334=With so much production coming from the charity stripe, there was often a lack of quality looks on the offensive end. Lipscomb went more than three minutes between made field goals on six occasions, including the final 3:47 of regulation., 7349=In their best shooting performance since the 2007-08 season, four Lady Bisons entered double figures. Junior Hannah Phillips scored a game-high 18 points and added six rebounds and a team-high five assists for good measure., 8897=The Lady Bisons return to the court to host Kennesaw State Saturday at 2:15 p.m.}

textAfterTable: 3P FG Percentage .000 (0-8) .600 (6-10) FT Percentage .516 (16-31) .791 (34-43) Offensive Rebounds 26 5 Defensive Rebounds 18 34 Total Rebounds 44 39 Turnovers 10 22 Steals 12 6 Bench Points 29 31 Statistical Leaders MERW LIP Points BRIDGES - 18 PHILLIPS - 18 Rebounds PHILLIPS - 13 MCALISTER - 7 Assists WILLIAMS - 2 BOYKIN - 2 BRIDGES - 2 PHILLIPS - 5 Steals BUCHANAN - 4 SMITH - 3 Blocks WILLIAMS - 1 PHILLIPS - 1 MCALISTER - 1 DUERK - 1 Thursday, December 01, 2011 NASHVILLE, Tenn. – An outstanding shooting performance gave the Lipscomb women's basketball team earned its inaugural win of the season Thursday night, defeating Mercer 80-70 to open Atlantic Sun Conference action. The victory came in a milestone game for Lipscomb head coach Frank Bennett, who coached his 1000th game at Lipscomb. Coach Bennett is 578-422 all-time as the Lady Bisons head coach.
